Creating a Numeric Field

For custom numeric fields, you can select either the integer (whole number) or the Real number (number with a decimal point) type. The application range for integers is 9 digits; the range for real numbers is 15 digits.

This procedure is a continuation of Creating a New Property Field.

To create a custom integer or real field:

  1. From the Add Field dialog, select Integer or Real from the Type text box.

  2. Enter a default integer or real value in the Default value text box. This value automatically becomes the value used for all existing items that have this field as a property. It also becomes the default value for newly created items. You can change this value manually by using the Custom tab of the item Property dialog.

    3. If you do not set a default, the application uses 0 (zero) as the default.

  3. Click OK.
